BUS101.name: Freshman Seminar for College of Business Students
BUS101.description: Exploration of students' interests. Interaction with business and academic professionals. Laying the foundation of skills and knowledge for success in business.
BUS101.restrictions: Open to freshmen in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of college.

BUS102.name: Career Seminar for Business Students
BUS102.description: Introduction to careers in business, the world of work, business professionals, and skills necessary for success in the business professions.

BUS201.name: Sophomore Seminar for Business
BUS201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
BUS201.description: Professional identity development as a global business leader. Topics include
BUS201.restrictions: Open to sophomores in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management. Approval of college.

BUS291.name: Special Topics: Introduction to Business
BUS291.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BUS291.description: Basic introduction to the functional fields in business and their interrelationship. Review of fundamental concepts and principles of business.

BUS491.name: Special Topics in Business
BUS491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
BUS491.description: Advanced study of interrelatedness of business functions not typically found in the business academic departments.
BUS491.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to students in the School of Hospitality Business.
